info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 22 at 5:20PM EDT until May 22 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 600 PM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN BERKS...SOUTHEASTERN LEHIGH...CENTRAL MONTGOMERY... NORTHWESTERN BUCKS...NORTHEASTERN CHESTER AND SOUTH CENTRAL NORTHAMPTON COUNTIES... At 519 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Ancient Oaks to Bally to Pottstown, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. Trees and wires down in parts of southern Berks County and upper Montgomery County. IMPACT...Damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. Locations impacted include... Allentown, Bethlehem, Pottstown, Lansdale, Emmaus, Quakertown, Perkasie, Doylestown, Hatboro, Souderton, Bedminster, Hellertown, Collegeville, Royersford, Chalfont, Trappe, Hatfield, East Greenville, Dublin and Ferndale. This includes the following highways... Northeast Extension between mile markers 26 and 54. Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 58 and 64. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
